author.name: Olav Sindre Kriken
author.description: 🚀 On a mission to reinvent how humans, teams, and computers work together - with a magnificent gang of humans at @tana_inc.

html: We are starting to send out invites again! The team has done an incredible job killing bugs, ironing our kinks, talking to the first users, improving Tana, and getting ready for the next round. 🙌\n\nTo everyone waiting to help, we are working double time to get there! 🚀 https://t.co/w76P6lWX0X

author.name: TfT Hacker - Exploring Tools for Thought and PKM
author.description: Exploring Tools for Thought space and PKM, with focus on tools like Obsidian, Tana, Craft, LogSeq, RemNote, AthensResearch, OneNote, etc https://t.co/GyMiAikIl1

html: We are starting to send out invites again! The team has done an incredible job killing bugs, ironing our kinks, talking to the first users, improving Tana, and getting ready for the next round. 🙌\n\nTo everyone waiting to help, we are working double time to get there! 🚀 https://t.co/w76P6lWX0X

author.name: Tana
author.description: On a mission to reinvent how humans, teams, and computers work together.

html: We continue to work our way down the waitlist, and today we're sending out the biggest batch of invites so far! 🚀\n\nNew logins will receive a brand new onboarding flow, as well as a range of new features – all based on input from people who have been invited so far.

author.name: Tana
author.description: On a mission to reinvent how humans, teams, and computers work together.

html: This input has also enabled us to iron out a lot of kinks, making it possible for us to invite at a higher pace in the coming weeks.\n\nThanks a lot for your patience, and thanks to everyone that has already provided their feedback and helped bring Tana closer to our beta! 🙏
